alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BRADFORD...NORTHEASTERN ALACHUA...SOUTH CENTRAL UNION AND SOUTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Worthington Spring to near Keystone Heights. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Starke, Keystone Heights, Worthington Spring, Alachua, Worthington Springs, Beasley, New River, Camp Blanding, Kingsley, and Sampson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Clay
